title: Potatoes For Profit: The Pros And Cons of Potato Farming | EP 132

subtasks: Research suitable land and regions for potato farming.
Consider soil suitability and potential diseases.
Investigate market demands for fresh or processed produce.
Start small to manage risk and learn.
Equip for irrigation, planting, lifting, and spraying.
Engage with experts and distribution companies.
Monitor weather and implement preventive pest management.
Adapt growing programs based on real-time conditions.
Collaborate with industry associations for insights and products.
